title: Marathon Pace Calculator
description: Calculate your running pace, time, or distance

0.title: Select Calculation Mode
0.description: Click one of the top buttons to choose what you want to calculate: pace, time, or distance. The disabled input field will show the result.

1.title: Enter Known Values
1.description: Fill in the enabled input fields with your known data. For example, when calculating pace, enter distance and time.

2.title: View Real-time Results
2.description: The result will automatically display on the central dashboard, including dynamic rings and pace indicator.

3.title: Adjust Units and View Splits
3.description: Use the unit toggle button to switch between metric and imperial. The table on the right shows split times per km/mile.

tip.title: Pro Tip
tip.description: You can also drag the rings directly to adjust distance and time, and see pace changes in real-time!

0.question: How does this calculator work?
0.answer: This calculator uses the basic running formula: pace = time รท distance. Based on your selected mode, it calculates the unknown value from the other two known values. All calculations happen in real-time.

1.question: What does pace mean?
1.answer: Pace is the time required per kilometer (or mile), typically displayed in 'minutes'seconds'' format. For example, 5'30'' means 5 minutes and 30 seconds per kilometer. Lower pace means faster running.

2.question: How do I switch between metric and imperial?
2.answer: Click the unit toggle button (with the cycle icon) in the top-right of the input area to switch between metric (km) and imperial (mi). All values will convert automatically.

3.question: What are split times?
3.answer: The split times table shows cumulative time at each kilometer (or mile) marker throughout your run. This is useful for planning race pacing strategies.

4.question: What do the colors on the rings represent?
4.answer: The central pace indicator's color changes based on pace intensity: cool colors (blue, cyan) indicate easy pace, warm colors (orange, red) indicate fast pace. This helps you quickly assess training intensity.

5.question: Can I drag the rings?
5.answer: Yes! Both distance and time rings are draggable. Click and drag the progress bar on the ring to adjust values in real-time. It's a fun way to explore different pace combinations.

6.question: What distances does the calculator support?
6.answer: You can enter any distance, or use the preset buttons for common distances: 5K, 10K, Half Marathon (21.0975 km), Marathon (42.195 km), and 50K.
